name: Patricia Kruse
text: We needed someone to schedule a home inspection quick. No one in town seemed to be able to do it but McNeese. They came out the next day and did a great job. Same day report and  I was able to keep my closing schedule.

resp.text: Patricia, we're glad we could come out to you on short notice! We'll be here if you need anything in the future. -Tim M., Owner

name: heather call
text: As a Realtor, I always need great home inspectors to recommend clients to and need someone knowledgeable on standby to ask questions. McNeese and his team always come through for me. They are fast, thorough, and dependable! I highly recommend Tim McNeese to all of my clients and always appreciate him being there for me when I need him.

resp.text: Heather, your kind words mean a lot to us! We're always happy to answer any questions you may have about the inspection given. Your recommendation is the reason why we love what we do. We'll be here if you need anything. -Tim M., Owner

name: Briona Watkins
text: Tim is amazing to work with! Very quick and precise on getting his job done. I have had numerous of clients use him for inspections and he delivers exactly what is needed every time. Highly recommend his services!

resp.text: Briona, precision is the name of the game with us! I'm glad I could help out by giving a quality inspection for your home. Let me know if you need anything else in the future. -Tim M., Owner

name: Corey Whaley
text: The inspector did a great job of catching the little things that we would have overlooked and attached a detailed description with photos of each issue.

resp.text: Corey, we're glad we could take a look at your home! We're always happy to answer any questions you may have in the future. -Tim M., Owner

name: Jerry Bourrell
text: Tim McNeese does an outstanding job! He has done everything from being a loan officer to actually building the houses himself. He knows what to look for and understands the process completely.

resp.text: Jerry, there is no nook or cranny that isn't inspected by me! I'm always happy to help out -- let me know how I can be of assistance in the future. -Tim M., Owner

name: Carey Rosenblum
text: Has done several home inspections on existing houses for several clients of mine and did a good thourough job.  Report was emailed  promptly and easy to understand.

resp.text: Carey, our passion is making sure you know all the details of a potential home! We're a phone call away if you ever need anything. -Tim M., Owner

name: Jess Stasko
text: I already posted a review about the terrible experience I had with how unprofessional the owner was and how the poor inspection caused cement in a pipe to be missed. Fast forward a year and a half later to having an inspection from a different company this week after listing our home - the bathrooms exhaust fan terminates you the attic. There is no duct attached or terminated to the exterior of the home. Now I have to deal with that in order to close. Wonderful. My realtor tried recommending Mcneese to me for the inspection of the home I’m buying - laughable. I wouldn’t recommend this business *at all*.

resp.text: Jessica, I am truly sorry your experience with buying that new home did not go well for you. Finding concrete in the main drain line is not something we would look for. This appears to be the work of an upset subcontractor. With new construction the last thing anyone would think to find is concrete in the main drain line. It is my understanding the contractor fixed that for you. We inspected your home, flushed toilets, ran water in the sinks. The issue did not show up at time of inspection to report it. I wish you luck on this next home purchase and the inspector you decide to use. I'm sure from your second Google post about my company you would not consider using us and I get that. But, if you decide to change your mind I would be happy to do it myself not one of my guys at no cost to you.. Best regards.

name: D Locke
text: I have used McNeese Home Inspections for multiple property inspections including my own home purchase. Tim & his team are always prompt, professional and do a great job inspecting homes.

resp.text: Our top priority is getting an accurate report to you, so you can make the best decision possible! We're a phone call away if you ever need anything. -Tim M., Owner

name: Lisa Strickland
text: Very knowledgeable, helpful, pleasant. Tim's expertise and willingness to help was very valuable in working though our recent transactions. Highly recommend this company!

resp.text: A home inspection can make all the difference with these sorts of transactions, Lisa. You were right to come to us. I'm proud that we could be of service to you. -Tim M., Owner

name: megan leotta
text: Missed a ton of stuff before we moved in (outlets not working, lights not working, etc.) and actually fell through our attic into our bedroom, leaving a huge hole in the ceiling. Promised to fix, came back once to partially patch but never came back. We're now listing the house and have to redo the entire ceiling because it's popcorn. Entire ceiling will have to be scraped and the patch, which is not flush with the ceiling, will have to be redone.

resp.text: Megan, I'm sorry that you're left dealing with the popcorn ceiling and ceiling patch as you sell. Please reach out to us so we can get to the bottom of what happened during our visit. It is possible that your outlets and lights have malfunctioned since we conducted our inspection, but if this is not the case, we would like to know so we can double check our tools. -Thank you, Tim M., Owner

name: Rachel Kepler
text: Very nice man. Moved into out home and with in 24 hours had a horrible leak in the bathroom and our AC was completely empty of freon and the coil had a leak..... Not only out of the inspection fee,but had to spend more money not knowing any of these problems existed..... This definitely killed our excitement buying our first home.

resp.text: Rachel, we thoroughly inspect the properties we work on and do our best to provide you with a clear understanding of any and all issues a particular home has. Unfortunately, it's always possible for new issues to emerge after an inspection. Even so, I'm sorry to hear that this negatively impacted your experience buying a home. If we can help with anything at this point, please reach out to us. -Tim M., Owner

name: bannor216
text: We are moving from Ohio and we were worried about not being present for the inspection. Tim provided ample pictures and a very thourough report which took the "guess work" out for us. Would recommend to anyone who needs a considerate, easy to work with inspector that know what he is doing.

name: Dawn Pettengill
text: Tim came highly recommended and I can see why.  He did a very thorough inspection on a property in Jackson County for me.  Thank you, Tim!

name: Jason Hill
text: Tim McNeese did a very thorough home inspection on a house I was buying over in the Morgan county area. He was very professional and took the time to explain his findings in great detail.

name: Robert Freeman
text:
Tim completed a home inspection for me on a house that I am considering buying.  This inspection was for me, not a bank or any other institution.  Just for me.
I am so thankful that I did.  He found a water leak from the chimney that was not readily visible.  If he had not found it, I may not have known until major damage occurred.  There were other issues I would have missed.
He was thourough, timely and his reports were very detailed.  In addition, I found him to be very friendly.
I would highly recommend his services if you are considering purchasing a home.

name: Nikki Choate
text:
Thanks for the great home inspection
David did a great job.

resp.text: A home inspection is a serious matter, Nikki, and we're not here to waste your time. We always have your interests at heart. Thank you for choosing us to be your inspectors. -Tim M., Owner

name: Sharlene Stephens
text: Read your contract carefully!!!

resp.text: We always want customers to feel completely comfortable with the terms of a contract before signing, Sharlene. If anyone has questions or concerns, we do all that we can to make sure everyone is on the same page. We're concerned to hear that you have lingering questions about your contract, and we're here to clear things up if you'd like to contact us directly. -Tim M., Owner

name: Ricky
text: They don't care about your home inspection, they just care about the money. Only contact them If you would like to end up with an unexpected costs/damages after closing on your home.

resp.text:
It is in our best interest to prevent our customers from having any unexpected costs when purchasing their home, Ricky. Buying a house is never a foolproof process. We work thoroughly to inspect your home, and we notify you of everything we find. There are certain instances where issues can arise with a home after our inspection. It sounds like this might be what you are dealing with.
Tim M., Owner

name: Clay Andrews
text: "Tim did a really thorough inspection and his experience as a building contractor gives me confidence in his ability to find any problems. "

name: Kaitlyn Hollis
text: Amazing service!!!

resp.text: Thank you!

text: Highly recommend new homebuyers or investors to take advantage of inspection south services.....thank you for report, it open my eyes to items I would have probably discovered months down the road after I made that purchase.......Mr Ron I'm grateful for your professional detailed report.....

text: Ron was great!  He was very responsive and during the inspection he was extremely professional and helpful. He explained everything in detail and even reached out after the inspection about questions. Highly recommend.

text: Inspections South was recommended to me by my daughter in law who works for a real estate company.   I needed an inspection on a home I wanted to purchase.   They were on time and very thorough.   Not only went over potential problem area but also discussed regular homeowner upkeep areas.   Was very pleased with the professionalism of this company.  The report furnished was easy to follow and understand.  They even provided a very extensive list of professional contractors and/or services for any current or future needs.    I highly recommend

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Nicholas Haddad
text: Second time working with Ron. He did out initial inspection and the follow up. Really love the way the report is laid out and enjoyed working with Ron and his staff. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you

name: Farrell Holland
text: Inspections South was easy to work with. Ron and his team completed a home inspection on a pre-listed home we were interested in for us. He and his team were thorough in both their inspection, delivery of the inspection findings, and in the written report. Their written report was easy to understand, and they offered a walk through of the property with the report before they left. He offered to provide references for plumbers, electricians, etc. for any repairs needed on the home later. I would. 100% recommend Ron and Inspections South.

resp.text: Thank you.

name: William C.
text: Corbin did an excellent job inspecting our new home. My wife was present during the inspection and stated he was very friendly and professional the entire time. Not only did they schedule an inspection quickly, They provided an 80+ page document with every possible fault/defect and how to address them before they become a problem. I would use them again and will recommend them to anyone who needs a home inspection.

resp.text: Thank you

name: Jay Pee
text:
Mr. Ron Glasscock and his son Corbin completed our home inspection.  They were on time (early, even) and thorough.  They both took the time to give us a walk-through and explanation of every item on the inspection report (Corbin inside, Ron outside).

They reached out before, and after, to ensure the inspection went smoothly.  The report itself is easily codified and read.  Making it a breeze to itemize things for price negotiations, or put them on your own to-do if you're at all handy.

I would not hesitate to recommend them to anyone I know in need of an inspection.

resp.text: Thank you.

name: Laura Watts
text: Extremely thorough and professional. Went above and beyond my expectations. The inspection report had very detailed information and was provided in a timely manner. I cannot say enough good things.

resp.text: Thank you

text: Ron and his son were great to work with. We felt they were very knowledgeable and down to earth. They were on time- actually, ahead of schedule- which they confirmed with us and worked out even better. They spend time inspecting before we arrive to have a walk through. They were very patient and willing to answer all of our questions. Drone footage of the roof allowed for safe, fast, and accurate inspection. We received our report via email a couple hours after the meeting. Thanks Ron, we appreciate it.

resp.text: Very welcome.  Thank you.

name: Taylor Korson
text: I am a first time home buyer. Ron was so kind and broke everything down for me, he walked around the house and pointed all potential problems out. He made feel comfortable with the process of becoming a first time home buyer. I highly recommend him!

text: Very professional. Great communication. Ron and his assistant were great. For the time 2 people spent on our pre-purchase inspection, I feel like it was a great value for the money. Probably less than it should be. Inspection report came the same day. Very efficient and easy to do business with. Just a great experience and definitely recommend if you need inspection services.

resp.text: Thank you.

name: Baskar Raj Savarimuthu
text: I  was very pleased with the Inspection done by Mr. Ron Glasscock. Actually I used his expertise for two properties. He is very thorough and explained things well. Surely I will recommend him to my friends.

name: Taylor Korson
text: I am a first time home buyer. Ron was so kind and broke everything down for me, he walked around the house and pointed all potential problems out. He made feel comfortable with the process of becoming a first time home buyer. I highly recommend him!

name: mike gyengo
text: Ron is the 2nd home inspector I have ever used and the difference between him and our first one was night and day.  He was extremely knowledgeable, professional and provided us with such a detailed and thorough report that I no longer have any anxiety about my pending home purchase.  I now know exactly what issues the home has and that I am capable of dealing with them.  Highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Megan Rose
text: Ron and Corbin were great! From the first phone call, Ron was professional, informative, and friendly. The instructions and pre inspection descriptions were very thorough and straight forward. The day of my inspection, there was a cellular outage nationwide. My carrier was affected, therefore my phone service was not working properly. Ron and his son, Corbin, were able to start the inspection early (after asking me if it was convenient for me first), and messaged me when they started the inspection and what time I could expect them to be finished. I ended up not receiving the message about the completion time, therefore having my real estate agent get in touch with me to tell me they were trying to reach me and were waiting on me. It took me 25 minutes to get to the home being inspected. Corbin stayed and waited until I arrived to go through the inspection results in person and on the property. He was very professional and thorough in his walk through. After receiving the report, there were zero questions because Corbin had already covered them at the in person review. I was very pleased with the entire process, and the quality of service. After calling multiple inspectors, they were also the most affordable. I would highly recommend.

resp.text: Thank you!

name: ira bornstein
text: Corbin did a terrific job inspection our new home prior to purchase. He arrived early, and was efficient in his work. He alerted us to a handful of items that we had corrected prior to closing, as well as providing us some maintenance tips that we would have been unaware of without his expertise. The cost of the inspection was well worth the investment, as we gained far greater value from his recommendations.

name: ptmontgomery09
text: Ron and his staff did a home inspection for us. They were thorough and prompt. Their easy to use report made understanding our home inspection quick and easy. They answered all of our questions and offered competitive pricing. We will definitely use them again in the future!

resp.text: Thank you!

name: Kayla Meklemburg
text: Amazingly detailed and honest. You can tell they actually care about their clients and aren't just in it for the money. I felt like they took great pride in their work.

resp.text: Thank you.

name: Ford Brown
text: This was hands down the best home inspection experience possible. We knew there were things coming in, but Ron and his team went above the call of duty. He listed out every single inspected item by color and description whether there was a problem or not. He talked to me like I was family. As a first time home buyer he hid nothing and explained everything in full that he saw needed to be dealt with now ... and over time. Him and his team did a fantastic job with a long PDF I can get to work on as soon as we move into the home!

resp.text: Thank you

name: Katlyn Reynolds
text: I am very pleased with this company, our inspector Ron Glasscock, and the report he sent over. I was referred to Ron by a friend and I am so pleased with his professionalism, rapid responses, and attention to detail. The home buying process is stressful enough but I can definitely say that this inspection process was stress free and easy. I contacted this company on a Wednesday and Ron was inspecting the home the next day. His report was sent back to me an hour after the inspection was completed, which was shocking because the report was extremely thorough with excellent pictures and descriptions. I couldn't have asked for a better experience! I will definitely recommend him to anyone needing an inspection. If you are looking for a professional inspector with high attention to detail, look no further. Ron Glasscock is your guy!

text: I recently had Ron & his son Corbin come & inspect my near 100 year old home & was beyond pleased with their work! You can definitely tell Mr. Ron is passionate about what he does by how well he taught his son. He and Corbin are both extremely knowledgeable. They discovered damage from a previous fire that I never would have found on my own. In the end, we did not purchase the property, due to a couple of serious issues we discussed with the inspectors at length. We will definitely hire them next time when we find a home we want to buy, and hope to use them for a pre-listing inspection on our home as well.

text:
I highly recommend Ron with Inspections South. 5 STARS! Not only did Ron and his team give us a highly detailed, easy to follow, and thorough inspection on our new house, but he also gave us some pointers and tips on the house we are selling. Due to his advice, at the home we are selling, we were able to tackle minor details and correct them before our house was inspected. Having our current home inspected before we put it on the market was the best thing we could have done. We were able to completely have the house ready for its inspection and it passed with flying colors.  Then, of course, we used Ron and his team on the house we are purchasing. He was able to point out a few things and explain to us what they were, why they were important, and what was needed to resolve the problems. He was very informative and explained everything to us during our walkthrough. He let us know what were safety issues and what were just routine maintenance items. Thanks to his attention to detail and his keen eye, we were able to get the seller to resolve several minor issues and a couple of safety issues before we move in. My wife and I feel much better now knowing Ron has looked at our new house and given us a report that is both very thorough and detailed, but also very easy to decipher. Hopefully this is the last time we move, fingers crossed, but if we ever move again, Ron and his associates will be our very first call!
Thanks Again Ron! Amazing Job at both our current home and our future home as well!

name: DJ RaptorXS
text: Mr. Glasscock is hands-down the best Inspector in the Birmingham area!   His expertise has saved me from making costly mistakes on two occasions.  He's extremely thorough, honest, and helpful in identifying both the flaws and positive features of properties, down to the fine details.  His reports objectively reflect his findings in an easy-to understand fashion, and he makes recommendations accordingly.  He breaks his findings down into 3 categories by level of skill needed to correct problem areas ranging from DIY to requiring professional service.  As an added convenience, Mr. Glasscock provides a reference list of local repairmen, contractors, handymen, etc., many of who are also public servicemen (firefighters, police officers, etc.).  Finally, Mr. Glasscock is extremely patient and willing to answer any questions during and after his inspection.  I would trust Inspections South any day, and it is my honor to give Mr. Glasscock and his son the highest of recommendations!

name: Brian Dayton
text:
I used Tyler Hughes Home Inspections for a purchase. Glad I did. He provided a non-invasive home inspection which found two critical costly errors if undetected. 1) Two small roof leaks (that would not have been obvious to the untrained eye) and 2)  A potential foundation issue. The sellers are correcting these issues but if is was not for Tyler it would have been thousands of dollars out of our pockets much later when it would have become a major problem. Take my advise, if you are buying or SELLING a house, hire Tyler so all parties are informed and there are no surprises that cause undo stress.

Many sellers do not think of hiring a prelisting inspection, if you do not then expect surprises.

I highly recommend Tyler Hughes Home Inspections and will be giving them as a referral to everyone I know. THANK YOU Tyler, you saved my family from very costly future problems!

text: We are buying a mobile home in Bama Park, so we were on the fence about getting a home inspection. I’m so glad we did. name: Crystal Adamson
text:
Kenneth Blair with Lake Martin Inspections was phenomenal!  His 50 page report was exceptionally detailed and  categorized areas of concern into three categories: Upgrade or Maintenance Recommendations; Moderate Recommendations that require a qualified contractor; Significant Safety Concerns that require repair and immediate attention. His Summary included all of these on one page list which made for a quick, easy-to-read reference guide. As we were purchasing an older 1970s home, he was also able to assist us with taking lead paint samples as this was one of our biggest concerns with having children in the home.   Further, he was able to recommend inspection specialist for HVAC, electrical, and foundation who came out same day or next.
Kenneth was on time, easy to contact,  and very professional. We would highly recommend his company and will use him again in the future!

resp.text: Thanks for the positive review. We wish you and your family the best with your new home.

text: Mr. Blair was absolutely a pleasure to work with, very knowledgeable, prompt and all around a true professional. On the day of the home inspection Mr. Blair arrived a few minutes before the time he said he'd be there, he came equipped with every tool of the trade to include the drone and even the under the house remote controlled car with camera since it was a tight crawlspace. Mr. Blair spent several hours on site in the brutal August heat and never complained one time, he was very diligent in his work and very knowledgeable. text: Inspector was very professional, thorough, knowledgeable and trustworthy.  I would recommend this company to anyone, and will be using their services more in the future.

name: Kirk Parsons
text:
I was very dissatisfied with the home inspection I received from Knock Out. The "inspector" did not even comment on the overly rotted retaining wall next to the house and even stated he didn't notice a retaining wall. After a quick phone conversation, he went back out and added a few comments ref the 230' RETAINING WALL! He also added notes about the wall "only" being 5 feet tall. BTW, there's NO safety rail at the top of the retaining wall, which is REQUIRED by code.

I asked a seawall/landscaper to look at the retaining wall. Of course it was found to be extremely poorly built and rotted. The estimate to repair/replace is $9,300.00.

I haven't found a single GFCI that functions properly in the home. None were noted in the inspection report.

So far I've found 3 leaking faucets that required new Pex fittings in order to repair.

There are some buried extension cords around the exterior of the house clearly being used as permanent electrical supply sources. Again, not allowed by code or OSHA safety.

The living room lights flicker whenever the outside lights are turned on. Still looking into this issue, thanks Knock Out!

I'd recommend going elsewhere for a quality home inspection.

name: Andrew Dahl
text: We were buying a house from afar so it was nice to have a professional, dependable inspector to review the house for us.

text: Mr Emerson Paulk is the best.  He was on time, very knowledgeable,  and performed thorough inspections.  He was straight forward and to the point.  He even took the time out to call the Gas company to let them know of a gas leak that was coming from the street, nothing to do with the inspection but this was an example of going the extra mile to make sure things were handled.   If you ever need a home inspection this is your go to guy. Thanks Mr. Paulk for your professionalism and your caring attitude. You are one of a kind.

text: Emerson is very excellent with his communication skills, quick to respond to phone calls, emails and even at night. Appreciate his business to inspect the home we intend of purchasing. Kind of the impression of the South with businesses is that they are lackadaisical but not with Emerson!

name: Tuti Tutti
text: Great inspector that was fast to respond to my online request and was able to schedule me in right away. His price was more than fair and his service was above par.  Even the tree contractor said he was the best in the business.  I contacted 6 inspectors, only 2 responded and he was the first, so as the saying goes, the early bird catches the worm. Thank you for a great inspection with plenty of pictures. :)

name: Gabriel Lewis
text: I have homes in multiple states and Emerson is the best inspector I've hired to assess any of my properties. While searching for a home in AL, I was smitten by a beautiful property and was ready to make an offer.  Luckily for me, Emerson was my inspector, because he found some MAJOR foundation issues and water damage that would have been a nightmare for me.  His expertise proved solid again with the next house I hired him to inspect. He found a defect on the pre-existing  home that multiple owners hadn't found on a home that was 16 years old.  This issue was fixed and I purchased the house. And just like Emerson said, it was a "game changer". I've had no issues with the property.  If you want a thorough, no BS inspection... Emerson is the guy.

name: William Adams
text: Just finished an inspection with Emerson on a new build.  I was on the fence about spending the money since it's new construction.  So glad I did!  Not only did he inspect the home in and out but he took the time to explain to me how all of the systems in the home work together.  More than just a simple thumbs up or thumbs down, Emerson identified opportunities to improve, reinforce and strengthen the home as to avoid future problems.  In addition, he identified risks with some of the design techniques the builders used, such as exhaust piping, and armed me with early warning signs to be mindful of.  I am exponentially more confident moving forward with the buy.  If your thinking of purchasing a new home, call Emerson.  Highest recommendations!

name: Gabriel Castillo
text: Emerson is very professional and an excellent inspector! He is very knowledgeable and takes the time to explain thoroughly every single detail of his findings! He will answer all your questions and returns emails/calls in a timely manner. You are definitely hiring someone worth your time/money and I highly recommend him for anyone needing a home inspection!

name: Jamie
text: This is our first time home-buying and I was hesitant at first about having an inspector. Emerson Paulk put me at ease and I am so impressed by their amazing service. They are so thorough and they include photos on the written report. Very professional and responsive as well. They do not disappoint and I would definitely recommend to all of my friends!

name: Forrest Harris
text: I am buying my first house and had several properties inspected to buy over the past couple weeks. The first inspection was with “the other guys” who were overpriced and assumed just because they had fancy equipment  they were exempt from thoroughly inspecting the more inconvenient places of the house. Emerson Paulk on the other hand, with the help of his team members, thoroughly inspected my potential house from head to toe. He was very thorough and systematic and welcomed any and all concerns and questions. One concern was water under the low crawl space; Mr Paulk suited up and made every effort to evaluate all corners of the dank areas. My report was timely and informative and enabled me to make an educated purchase. I would definitely use them again and recommend them to everyone I know!

name: Not Available
text:
It is overwhelming when you are a first time
home buyer and that was all put at ease when I first met Emerson Paulk. My first concerns were how much it costs for a home inspection after seeing and going through the process I can confidently say it is worth every penny. I was astonished by his thoroughness and attentive to detail during his inspection. He often even made sure to point out little issues and gave easy recommendations for a frugal and professional fix to some of the minor hiccups in the house. They took no short cuts and made sure to get in every nook and cranny to make sure he can confidently evaluate the property without any unforeseen issues. He is definitely the home inspector that I’ll will be using for any future endeavors.

name: Katlyn Watson Williams
text: I would highly recommend this home inspector!! He was very professional and very thorough in our report. I appreciated that he takes the time to educate buyers as well.

text: In my search for anything, I always look at reviews and it was the sole reason I decided to choose Emerson. I couldn't have made a better choice.  He's professional, returns calls, returns emails in a timely fashion, shows up on time, he sent the report BEFORE the deadline, and is very knowledgeable.  I felt comfortable that if there were issues, he would find them...and he DID!  Emerson made some very major finds and booking him was money well spent. Mr. Paulk is knowledgeable, thorough, dependable, friendly, and I would recommend him to ANYONE buying a home, even if it's a new build.

name: Niaz Morshed
text: We used Mr. Paulk for our home inspection. He was very good and knew what he was doing and what need to do when you inspect a home. He maintained his time very well and explained every single issue with me. I was very happy with his service and recommend him for home inspection.

name: Joseph B.
text: My wife and I were very impressed of how thorough Mr. Paulk was when discussing the inspection. He was very personable and gave us a peace of mind knowing the overall condition of our soon to be  home and what needed attention. He was more than willing to answer an questions we had and was very detailed  in making sure we understood his answer . I would recommend his services to anyone I know. Hands down...Mr. Paulk is one of the best.

name: Kenneth Fair
text:
If you are looking for a dependable, qualified, professional, and straight to the point home inspector, this is definitely the guy for you.  I recently built my home and got the idea from my mom to get an inspector throughout the entire process rather than at the end.  What invaluable advice that was because his services throughout the entire process saved me thousands and many unnecessary headaches that we as homeowners don't usually see or experience until we are in the new house.

His professional expertise and thoroughness made this one of the BEST DECISIONS  I've ever made!

name: Director Of Operations
text: One of the best home inspection experience I ever had.From the initial contact over the phone to Emerson showing up to my house, he made it a  hassle free, pleasant and courteous experience.  Emerson  was thorough, professional, detail oriented, very knowledgeable and courteous. During the inspection, his hawk eyes made all the difference for me.  There were so many concealed issues with this house, but Emerson caught them. After the inspection, he took time to walk me through the issues and explained everything to me.  Less than 24 hrs later, I received my inspection report and it was concise with supporting pictures and recommendations. This is a true qualified professional who cares about the quality of his work and I can honestly say I made a friend that day. I can definitely say I will be using Emerson again in the near future.

name: James May
text: Emerson Paulk Home Inspections is everything anyone could want in a home inspector. Not only does he tell you, he teaches you during the inspection. I recommend Emerson for all of your home inspection needs!

name: Emily Parker
text:
It was such a pleasure to do business with Mr.Paulk!! I am a first time home buyer, and rather young, so I was taken back by how much Mr.Paulk dedicated his services and time to teaching me and making me more aware of technical terms and upkeep on my home. He went above and beyond and had such a GREAT attitude the entire time!!
Leaving my future home this past Wednesday after the inspection, I cried tears of joy.. This has really been an amazing experience. The most self fulfilling experience I have had thus far in my life. And I give a BIG THANKS to Emerson Paulk for making me SO comfortable and giving me all of the knowledge I needed about my home and how to care for it!
If you are undecided on a home inspector, or if you aren't sure you want one done at all - I would recommend doing it and hiring the BEST for the job!! Thank you, again, Emerson!

name: Joshua Foley
text:
BLUF: To my fellow military moving to Maxwell, Emerson is your go-to-guy.

I'm active duty in the AF, and so I didn't have the luxury of going to inspect the home I'd be spending 200K+ on. I did some searching, and I found Emerson. I made the call and spent a very affordable amount of money on an inspection for the home I've not actually seen yet.

Emerson worked promptly and meticulously. He was there on the day we scheduled, and he reported back to me with a complete review with the utmost attention to detail. He even highlights what recommendations he has in his findings like the one I've attached. He checks under, over and inside, and yes, the rooftop too.

At the end of it, all his well-written PDF is easy to understand and very reliable. You really get what you need, and I wish Emerson worked nationwide for my career's sake.

name: Latrecia Curtis
text: I am so impressed by Emerson Paulk Home Inspections LLC! I chose this company because it didn't have a single bad review and everyone gave him 5 stars and I now know why! Even when you make a mistake he doesn't!!! Thorough and patient and kind all describe this guy. I searched for someone I felt I could trust and found it with him. Ladies and Gentlemen don't look any further for your home inspection needs. He literally took the time to go over all his findings good and bad, great and small. He spoke to me in  a way that I could understand (no technical terms or big words). I recommend this company and look forward to working with him again someday!

name: Isaac Reid
text: Mr. Paulk did excellent work inspecting my home. After having some trouble with the builder of my new home I decided to have an inspection done. Mr. Paulk came out at a time that was convenient for my work schedule and spent extra time answering my questions and adding to the inspection report concerns i had with cosmetic issues the builder was attempting to ignore. Mr. Paulk did find some issues that I would never have seen that were caused by the sloppy and fast paced work the builder was doing and with Mr. Paulk's extensive and thorough report i was able to have those issues fixed and had the leverage I needed to get the builder to fix things I had issue with prior to Inspection. I would whole -heartedly recommend Emerson Paulk to be your home inspector.

text:
Very professional and knowledgeable. Prompt  with report.
Would recommend to anyone.

text: Bama Exterminating did general, quarterly exterior spraying for pest control at my house for many years.  I thought it was a good price for the service.  The only roaches I ever saw were dead.  Their technicians were especially helpful about answering any questions I had and addressing specific concerns when they came up.  They taught me to identify a brown recluse spider and gave me glue traps for mice.  They were always respectful.

resp.text: Thanks for the 5 star review and kind words, Kim! We are thrilled to know that you had an incredible experience with our team and you're seeing great results! Our goal is to make pest control as simple as possible for our customers because we understand how busy life can be. We appreciate your business. Thank you for choosing Bama Exterminating! Please don't hesitate to let us know if we can be of service.

name: Steve Cory
text:
Salton from Bama exterminating knocked on the door today and I asked him to come inside since it was so hot.
I had my inspector Gadget magnifing glass trying to find the heating instructions for a  tv dinner. Dalton help me find the instuctions and even programmed the microwave oven.
3 years ago i had a stroke that left me almost blind.  Dalton's Kindness and willingness to help made my day.  Bama Exterminating is a top shelf business with top shelf employees. Call them today for all your exterminating needs.

resp.text: Hi Steve, thank you so much for the 5-Star review! Dalton does a great job and is always thorough, professional, friendly, and helpful. We are thrilled to know that he helped you get your microwave up and running and took excellent care of you! Our technicians really do go above and beyond for our customers. We love knowing that you had an A+++ experience! From everyone at Bama we are sorry to hear that you had a stoke and please let us know if you ever need anything! We appreciate your business and the feedback!

name: Robin Maddox
text: I can always depend on Bama to remind me (nag if needed) of my regular service and add on mosquitoes in the summer. They take great care of us and have for a long time.

resp.text: Hi Robin! Thank you for sharing your experience with Bama Exterminating and our community. We are so happy to hear that you can depend on us. These kind words is what makes our job worth doing everyday.  I can't wait to share your feedback our team! We really do appreciate your business. Please don't hesitate to let us know if we can be of service. You are apart of the Bama Fam Jam. We are hear for you!

text: The technicians were personable, professional, and efficient. They treated my home with Termidor, which can be disruptive and messy since it requires drilling into concrete surfaces and getting next to exterior walls. However, they cleaned up after themselves, returned things they had to move, and were done in a little over an hour.

resp.text: Hi Jamie! Thank you for sharing your experience with Bama & our community. We are doing our best to make it super easy to have a termite & pest free home! These kind words mean a lot to us. This is what we strive for every day. I can't wait to share your feedback with our team. We really do appreciate your business! text: We signed up for quarterly pest control because the house already had an existing termite contract with them. After the first spray, we kept getting earwigs (like 1 a day) inside the house (half of the time they were very much alive). We called and they sprayed again. It didn't stop the earwigs. Second spraying comes around and same thing- earwigs inside every day. This time when we contacted them (2 weeks ago), they ignored us. They also didn't call when they came to spray the second time so if hadn't been home, he wouldn't have been able to get inside or in the backyard. We signed a year contract and I'm not sure what it would take to get out of that. But signing a contract should have been a signal they were bad. Good results don't require a contract to keep people stuck. Be aware of the contact too- it only covers a very limited amount of pests.

text: Quick to come out and handle any issues in between regular services.

name: Catherine Lee
text: My roommate and I had a terrible experience with this company. To start, the employee sprayed the wrong house the first time we made an appointment. This was very inconvenient for my roommate and I to figure out another time to have the guy come spray our house. Once we got home after finally having our house sprayed, we noticed some of our belongings had been gone through. There was jewelry rearranged, purses opened, and a ring was lying in the hallway by the kitchen. We were very confused because the only person who had been in our house that day was the exterminator. We looked through our belongings and came to find that a Michael Kors watch was missing (est. $225), Apple T.V (est. $100+),  jewelry (est. $600+), and cash. We are not explicitly accusing anyone of stealing, but we have high suspicions because the exterminator was the only one in the house that day. Keep in mind that it was required for everyone in the house to evacuate during the spraying procedure. We are extremely violated and hope this does not happen to anyone else.

text: My company has used their services for years. We love the great managerial staff, and the technicians we've had have always been willing to work with us and our tenants. I'd suggest them to anyone!

name: Kevin Foote
text: Bama Exterminating is the best pest control in town, hands down. They're organized enough to handle a heavy workload, but small enough to focus on their customers & provide great service. Good people at Bama. Would recommend them to my own mother!

name: Jeanette Haley
text: My experience with Bama has been very good.  The people sent to our home have been prompt, professional, courteous and helpful.  We have been pleased with the service.

name: Pam Sewell
text:
We have used Bama for about 15 years (in 3 different houses).  Nice techs that come to my house. Have rarely seen a live "bug" inside the house - but if I do and it's not time for the next quarterly service, I call them and they come out and re-spray at no charge.
We recently moved (about 4 months ago) and, though, still in a neighborhood, this time our house backs up to woods instead of a neighbor's house.  We had ticks and "critters" in the yard everywhere! - some I had never seen before in my life! Carly came and did a TOTAL inside and outside spray (the entire yard!) before we started the quarterly service at this house.  Bugs and ticks are GONE! Wheee!  I still see an occasional 'millipede' (sp?) but I think as we continue the quarterly service, they will disappear too (they are rough ole hard-shelled critters!). 4 Thumbs Up! ;-)

name: Alex Seiver
text: I had an absolutely fantastic experience with Bama Exterminating Co. - the team that came do perform the termite protection on my home were punctual, friendly, courteous, professional, and above all, did a great job! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend Bama Exterminating to anyone looking for pest and termite protection.

name: Britt Marshall
text: Have been using their services for many years.  Have always been extremely happy with their thoroughness, their hospitality and their professionalism.  If you are in need of termite bond or pest control services, you should use them.

name: Delmar Thomas
text:
I had Bama Exterminating for a few years until I ran into some problems with them being sloppy.  I live out of state, but used them for my second home in AL.  I specifically asked them from the beginning to put my primary out-of-state home address as the billing contact.  For years, they would conduct the service and send the bill to my primary address out of state.  I always immediately paid for their services via credit card over the phone.  For my annual ant and terminate inspections this year, I just happen to call them to schedule things, and they said, "we closed your account because of failure to make a payment."  ???  I told them I never received a bill nor knew there was an outstanding balance.  I asked what the billing address was...never got a straight answer.  Eventually, the phone representative admitted to the possibility that Bama may have sent it to the AL home where the service was being performed.  Also not true, because my mom lives there and sends me all bills that come to the house.  The phone rep even had the nerve to say "we were sending the account to collections."  I never even knew there was a bill due!  And they obviously make no attempts on their end to keep in touch with the customer.  That was issue No. 1.  Nonetheless, I immediately paid the outstanding balance and that issue was resolved, despite Bama's sloppiness and failure to communicate.

Issue No 2., they have an absolutely unconscionable provision in their agreement that says something to the effect of, "Customer must give 30 days written notice before getting out the the Agreement."  The very next sentence in the Agreement says, "Bama may cancel the contact without notice at any time for any reason."  What?!

Besides the fact that such a provision would never hold up in court if there ever were a dispute, it is a completely onerous clause.  They're not selling gold, they spraying chemicals on the ground, for goodness sake.  No need for such an unfair clause.  I asked the representative for a reason for such an unfair clause.  She responded something to the effect of, "we need that in there for customers who don't pay."  What????  Well, in my opinion, such language is waaaay over broad for such a limited scenario as nonpayment.  Anyway, I refused to agree to it, Bama Exterminating refused to change or delete it, and we parted ways.  I signed up the same day with their competitor, who actually ended up being cheaper...and more organized as well.  I have been happy so far.

There is a fine line between a mom and pop operation and a sloppy operation.

name: leslie crawford
text: Wont use bama exterminators again. They are liars. Say one thing and do another.

resp.text: Hello Leslie, we are so sorry you have had a negative experience with us. We aim to provide superior pest control services to our clients and to always be upfront about all aspects of our business and services. To ensure we are maintaining this level of superior service we keep very detailed records of all interactions with our team. We will review your account and reach out to you if any additional information is needed to resolve this matter. Please feel free to call us anytime you have questions.

text: 10/10 recommend!

resp.text: WOW! 5 stars and a 10/10! We can't thank you enough Amber! We value your service and look forward to seeing you again in the future!

name: Parminder Pruthi
text: We had roachs problem. Three different companies we tried, no one could solve the problem. Then my friend told me that he had the same problem and advised to hire Bama exterminator. Finally Bama exterminator eliminated the problem.

text: Great experience with Bama! They are second to no one in the business

name: Amy Nichols
text: We've owned two homes in Northport and Bama has serviced both so well! Our first home had a crawl space and we inherited a major pest issue from the previous homeowners. Bama got us fixed up! In our newer home, on a slab, we thought we could go without pest control, but learned quickly that if you don't do SOMEthing to prevent them, those little brown yuckthings WILL come in your home. No matter how clean you are. So we called Bama back and have been satisfied (and bug-free) customers ever since!

name: Brandi Stacey
text: We could not be more pleased with Bama Exterminating. All of the employees are kind, helpful, and professional.

name: Matt Fulghum
text: Courteous and professional, not to mention prompt.  Service was excellent.

name: Dr. Lindsay Greenlee
text:
This company is unprofessional and their customer service is severely lacking.  In my case, they made several mistakes and refused to admit to or even rectify their own mistakes.  I purchased my home four years ago and it came with a termite bond with Bama Exterminating.  This year (2014) they mailed me a contract to sign regarding that termite bond with dates listed from 2012 to 2014.  In essence, because they made a mistake and did not have me sign a contract when I purchased the home, they were trying to get me to agree to terms for the previous years to cover themselves legally while disregarding the legal issues for the customer.
I called their office manager, Kim Ousley, to inquire about this contract and she was unable to explain why I was receiving this contract four years after the home purchase and why the contract had a start date listed as 2012.  After getting frustrated with my questioning and being unable to answer the questions posed to her, she hung up the phone.
Then, I spoke with another employee, Mr. Bridges, who did manage to explain at least why I was receiving this contract at the time I did.  However, he did not see any issue with me agreeing to terms, in writing, that were two years in the past.  He also did not see any issue with Ms. Ousley's behavior even though she was unable to explain their contract and hung up on a customer after getting flustered.
So, there are a serious of problems here that are all the mistake of Bama Exterminating and the company refused to rectify their mistake.  First, they should obtain a new contract when homes are sold for the new owner.  They failed to do that in my case.  When they realized their mistake (in 2012), they continued to let the contract go unsigned.  In 2014, they mailed a letter and a contract dated for 2012.  In the letter they stated they could not renew my termite bond UNLESS I signed the back-dated contract.  This seems reasonable except the mistake was on their end and I shouldn't be required to sign things I am uncomfortable signing and they refused to fix it.  I offered to sign a current contract but they would not do that unless I signed the back-dated one.  Finally, the way the office manager, Ms. Ousley, handled the call was unfortunate.  If she did not have the proper information or could not communicate effectively with the customer, she should have found someone else to help rather than hang up the phone on a long-term customer.
In sum, there were multiple errors made this company and even after I offered to sign a current contract, they refused to fix their mistake or even take responsibility.  I would not recommend doing business with this company until they refine their business practices.  There are many more companies that offer the same type of services and will offer better customer service.

***Update - I hired their competitor for half the cost yearly and I would suggest doing that.  From what I have learned about pest control, Bama Exterminating is using older bait stations which is why they need to come service them four times a year.  Companies that use more modern equipment are lower cost because the stations need to be serviced less often.

text: We moved into our new home 10 months ago and our builders warranty is set to expire soon. It was the best money I have spent on my new home. There were so many things. Some disturbing. Example was my builder installed a 2015 air conditioner in a home built in 2020!  It was already 5 years old once installed. We are meeting to discuss that among other things. I highly recommend Pillar to Post and I thing that everyone who has a new build should spend the money and get this service performed. Well worth the cost!

name: Glennleigh Mwakajumba
text: Cannot speak highly enough of these guys. They did an inspection on a home my husband and I were really excited to purchase. We knew it had some issues, but had no idea to what extent. We ordered the middle of the line inspection, but about 30 minutes into the inspection, James called me and suggested I bump it down to the lower (and cheaper) level inspection. Basically, the foundation of the house was in such a state, he didn't want to us to spend money on him looking at all the little nooks and crannies when the house had so many big expensive issues that he could inspect with the lower level inspection. I met them at the house and they were so helpful and kind, walking me through all the different areas and explaining/describing potential problem areas. I learned so much and was so grateful for them! I also asked for tips as we continue house-hunting so we would not proceed on any houses with obvious structural issues. They gave me some tips for house-hunting and things to look out for... Again, I was just so grateful and we won't buy a house without having Pillar to Post take a look at it.

The report was easy to navigate and the recommendations coincided with what was seen and explained to us by Jason.  We would highly recommend NPI and Jason to anybody purchasing a new home or needing a professional home inspection.

name: Zac Bowen
text:
I had my home inspected by NPI Birmingham and was incredibly impressed with the service I received. The inspection was thorough and the report is incredibly well laid out and available online very soon after the inspection was completed. At the inspection Jason went over the report in great detail and explained everything that I did not understand (as a first time home buyer this was quite a few of the items).

Additionally, there were multiple delays in the construction of my home that required the inspection date to be delayed multiple times (some with _very_ little notice). Jason was incredibly patient with us and his flexibility allowed us to get the inspection and necessary repairs done without having to delay the closing date yet again.

If I ever need another inspection done on a home in the Birmingham area I will be using NPI Birmingham again!

name: David Coutoumanos
text: I’m a real estate broker and have my own property management company and in all my years in business, I haven’t met a better home inspector. Chuck Wall is a true professional and has the patience and integrity to really comb through a property. We bought a multifamily property downtown and hiring Wall to Wall was the best thing we did. He caught some foundation and drainage problems that we would have never noticed. Even months later, we still frequent his inspection report.

name: Meagan Reif
text: Chuck went above and beyond for our home inspections. He takes his time inspecting the entire property and is extremely thorough and knowledgeable. He provided a detailed written report the same day with pictures of all potential concerns he found throughout the house. He personally went over the report with me, explaining each of his findings and ensuring all my questions were answered. Chuck identified subtle clues to a potentially devastating foundation/structural issue, and recommended we hire a licensed structural engineer to further evaluate the property. I appreciated that he was objective and did not try to sway us one way or the other. After the structural engineer confirmed Chuck’s suspicions, we backed out of the purchase and saved ourselves from a probable disaster. When we found our next home, I immediately called Chuck and he was quick to respond on short notice when I needed him, and he once again provided his excellent service. I would absolutely recommend hiring Chuck Wall, especially if you’re looking for a home inspector who does high-quality work and is someone you can trust!

text: Professional staff and very responsive.  Thanks for your expertise during our home buying experience!

name: anthony walker
text: Quick response and thorough inspection!

name: Tripp Johnson
text: I couldn't be more pleased with the home inspection experience from Dwight and his team.  He allowed me to accompany him during the inspection and answered all my questions.  He provided a detailed report and was extremely thorough.  I highly recommend Home Check Consultants.

name: Bre McGhee
text: The inspectors were very nice. Only gave three stars because they didn't include a leak under the kitchen sink in the inspection that we didn't find until after we purchased the home and moved in. Also the rotted wood that was caused by the leak. Pleasant people but I wouldn't recommend them

name: Pamela Christian
text: Very lazy inspector. He inspected our home and wrote up windows and electric outlets that had furniture in front of them. He wrote up blown light bulbs. He wanted to recharge the buyers to check those things and said it is not his job to move furniture. As the homeowner, who wants things right for the buyer, we are checking those things because he charges people but doesn't want to do a complete job for them.  I try to share when people do great work but thought this needed to be shared as well.

name: James Nesselroad
text: I was impressed with Jon's knowledge and experience. Jon was able to answer all of my questions in detail. The final report was extensively detailed. I could definitely see that Jon takes pride in what he does. I would most definitely recommend NPI.

name: Jessica Beer
text: I highly recommend National Property Inspections! We have had two inspections done and were so pleased. The reports were very thorough and Jon was so informative! We will use him again in the future for sure!

name: Karen Fricks
text: Jon has completed home inspections for us several times. Each time we have experienced excellent service, the utmost in professionalism and a most thorough inspection. We have even had sellers remark that they had never experienced a more thorough inspection. We highly recommend National Property Inspections of Northwest Georgia!

name: Ajeenah Carroll
text: Jon was great. This was only our second home purchase in eleven years so we had a lot of questions. Jon was patient and answered all of our questions. His follow up via phone and email was always prompt. He gave us great guidance during the due diligence period. I would highly recommend his service.

name: Heather Heebner
text: John was very thorough and sat down with us after his inspection and reviewed everything with us. His report was extremely detailed and arrived when he promised it would. I would highly recommend John to anyone looking to have a quality home inspection completed.

name: Jung Hagan
text: We were very impressed with the responsiveness of National Property Inspections.  They responded to our short notice request rapidly, performed the pre-Sheetrock Inspection within days of the request and provided a very professional, thorough, detailed report within days of their inspection.  The Inspector was very professional and experienced.  We will be calling on him again for a final inspection before closing.  I highly recommend them,

name: pc rich
text: I was very happy with my home inspection by Jon and his team.  It was very thorough and Jon was able to walk me through the home via video chat with my realtor as I was purchasing from our of state.  Three months in and I have found no real issues that the inspection didn't turn up.  Thanks!

name: Justin Holcomb
text: Very friendly personality. Great at answering any questions about the property and advising solutions to any potential problems. Timely communication via email. Very knowledgeable and provides a thorough inspection report.

name: Darina Yankey
text: Very thorough and well informed. Report was  very detailed and complete! I will call them again with the next transaction.

name: Kaitlin Waters

A terrific job by Jon and I would highly recommend him to others.

text: Jon’s experience and attention to detail are second to none. We are very happy and highly recommend their services.

name: David Cribbs
text: Did a great job on multiple home inspections throughout our buying process. Was very thorough and meticulous. Would definitely use NPI again!

name: Amanda McCall
text: Working with Jon is always such a great experience! I know that I can refer him to my clients and know that he is going to go above and beyond to make sure the inspection is done well and right. I would highly recommend them!

text: Jon McCreath is knowledgeable and leaves no stone unturned when inspecting your home. He is the homeowners and buyers best asset.

text: Jon is my go to home inspector for all of my buyers. He has a knack for working thru the home to discover the good and bad of every home he inspects. I appreciate all he does for my clients and their well being.

text: Aside from an extremely thorough inspection, Jon follows up with his clients. Love him!

text: Very professional, extremely helpful with the whole process. I recommend them to everyone.

name: Paula Zaimis
text:
We used NPI three times, and each time was great. The first two houses had some peculiar things that Jon had found, that led us to our third house which we love.

Every little thing was taken into account. From cracks in the wall that you'd never see yourself, to gutter/roof problems.

Jon filled out a complete report with pictures, issues, and possible issues. All with details of what to repair, and how/what needs to be done.

All questions were answered thoroughly, and Jon was very patient with every (probably dumb) question.

I give them a 5/5 for the whole nine yards. Would definitely recommend.

name: Ambur Caudell
text: John and his crew were very friendly, did a very detail inspection and gave wonderful advice. I would highly recommend using NPI.

name: norman campbell
text: Jon and his team are absolute professionals. I would highly recommend National Property I inspections even to the pickiest of home buyers.

name: Pamela A. Cordeiro Fraser
text: Jon McCreath of National Property Inspections did the inspection of the condo I was planning to buy in July 2017.  I have never seen anyone conduct a property inspection in such a meticulous, thorough, and methodical way.  He even included items in his final report that did not need to be inspected because of it being a condo unit, i.e. the roofing tiles.  After reading the inspection rerport, I was completely satisfied that it would be safe to purchase this property.  If I were ever to purchase another property, I would not want anyone other than Jon McCreath of National Property Inspections to conduct the inspection.

name: Shefali Chandaria
text: We've used National Property Inspections twice and thoroughly impressed with the quality of work!

name: Jasmin Dix
text: John is quick, reliable and thorough. You can't ask for anything more !

name: Robin Hayden
text: Great company. Five stars for sure.

name: Drew Warner
text: I recently used National Property Inspections to complete an inspection of a home I was going to purchase.  NPI came highly recommended to me by my realtor so I decided to use them for the inspection.  When I gave them a call, I was able to schedule the inspection rather quickly which was great!  I had the pleasure of meeting with Jon McCreath, the inspector who looked at my home.  Jon was a pleasure to work with, very knowledgeable, and definitely has a passion for what he does!  He inspected everything from the roofing, exterior, interior, electrical, foundation, HVAC systems, etc.  He also was taking pictures of what he was looking at for his report.  Before he left, he personally showed me some of the areas of concern and different things he found. When Jon emailed me my report, I was completely blown away with the amount of detail and information he provided.  This was a 48-page report full of clear notes, areas of concerns, pictures, and most importantly, recommendations of repairs needed.  My realtor was able to use the information provided in NPI’s report to get the seller to make some necessary repairs to the home before we closed.  I was very impressed with Jon’s professionalism and NPI.  I would definitely recommend National Property Inspections for your home inspection!

name: bud atkinson
text: Very concise and to the point with a great deal of professionalism

name: Theresa Perkins
text: Very professional and answered ALL my questions!

name: Scott Dever
text: Very good result.

name: Stephanie Mansmann
text: The owner, John, took care of my project personally. He is very helpful and was willing to work within my budget, everything is getting done in stages and I'm so excited, my house is going to look amazing when we are done!

name: Morgan Harlan
text: Mr. Ellis and his associate took their time and provided a very thorough inspection. He was extremely professional and very patient as he answered every one of my questions and took the time to explain findings. We HIGHLY recommend this company! As a 5th time homebuyer we have much to compare to and this has been by far the best experience we’ve had. Won’t choose anyone else within their service area, we’ll always choose Ellis first.

name: L. Cornwall
text: Jim was excellent! He really helped us to buy the right property

name: Penny Dupre
text: Ellis Home inspections came recommended from our realtor. Reviews were great. Scheduling was quick and easy. We got our report the same day. However, a few issues were missed. Our realtor actually called and had the inspector come back to edit his report after SHE saw areas around a window with water damage that wasn’t noted. After closing, the first day in our home we found fairly significant rotting wood near a door where water was leaking. It cost us thousands to have repaired. Had we known, we would have asked the sellers to repair or lower the price. Instead we are out the money. We were buying from out of town so relied on a good, detailed report. Beware, quick doesn’t mean thorough.

name: Ryan Davis
text: So glad I decided to use Ellis Home Inspections. Our inspector, Richard, was early and had everything done when we arrived at our appointment time. He was very friendly and even gave us ideas for our new home purchase. If you are reading this just go ahead and book the inspection with these guys, you will not regret it!

name: Sheree Garrison
text: Kevin Rose is phenonemal!  He is very timely and does a very thorough inspection.  I would recommend him and this Company!

name: Anna Akins
text: Ellis Home Inspections has been professional and thorough each time we have used their services. Once they completed the inspection on our home, they were able to send our inspection report via email within a 24 hour period. They will even send it to your real estate agent or someone else, if you request. Even after the inspection, Ellis Home Inspections' continues to keep us up to date on what we should check or repair in our home, in order to keep it up to par, through a monthly newsletter. My husband and I look forward to receiving the monthly newsletter in order to keep our home maintained and  secure.

resp.text: We're so happy we were able to help, and we're happy to continue to do so!

name: davjau
text: We used Jim Ellis for our home inspection. He was very thorough and caught several subtle issues that added up to be major overall problems. He was very polite and answered all my questions going around the home. I was very satisfied and I will be calling Jim for any future home inspections.

name: suzanne beard
text: I highly recommend Ellis Home Inspection.  Kevin Rose was our inspector.  He was friend,  promptly arrived and took time to explain what problems he found.  Ellis Home Inspectors charged a reasonable rate and we are very happy.  Highly recommend this company and Kevin Rose.

text: I chose Ellis Home Inspections for our inspection based off of their website and reviews. I'm happy to say that I was not disappointed at all. Mr. Ellis got to the location early so when it was time to begin he hit the ground running. He put me at ease by answering all my questions in layman's terms and he did not make me feel like I was asking too many. His report was very concise and easy to understand. I would highly recommend using Ellis Home Inspections as I will use them again in the future.

Thanks so much Richard you were amazing

name: Josh Hostler
text: If you're in the market to buy a home I would absolutely recommend Ellis home inspections for your inspection. My inspector was on time, very professional and literally checked every nook and cranny in the house. I feel 100% more confident buying this home now that its been inspected by them. He took the time to explain everything to me and how to maintain each separate thing in the house to keep it working properly and extend its life. He told me what to watch out for and gave me recommendations for things to repair that would improve the safety of my home. Being a family man that was a big deal for me. They are priced competitively and you simply cant beat their service. My inspector was Jim and I will recommend them to anyone I know from now on who is in the market to buy a house.

text: Ellis inspection was very helpful to me. The answered all my questions and pointed things I would have missed. I definitely give them five stars.

text: Great company! Good service, very informative and PUNCTUAL. How refreshing!

name: Gavin Karski
text: We were extremely thankful we hired Ellis inspection services for our home inspection. They were thorough and gave new homeowners, like ourselves, tips on how to keep our home working in its optimal condition.  We are very glad we hired them. I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Cheryl Fromularo
text: I hired Ellis Inspection Services in July of 2012 to inspect a home I was buying.  I was very, very unhappy, and cannot recommend them.  The man who did the inspection missed glaring signs of a significant previous water leak under the kitchen sink.  When I moved in, the humidity in the house activated green mold in all my lower cabinets.  Although I washed them repeatedly with bleach the mold would not stop, and the cabinets had to be replaced.  That cost me $3000.00.  Their guarantee apparently did not apply.  Additionally, my sprinkler system, which the inspector declined to test, needed all of the sprinkler heads replaced (yes, all) and the motor as well.  That cost me $690.00.  Again, their guarantee apparently did not apply.   Mr. Ellis is a nice person, his inspector was not a good inspector, and he supported his inspector.  I hope everyone that reads this chooses another company.

name: Gregg Kell
text: Attention to detail and excellent customer service delivered with integrity.  This is my experience with Jim Ellis and the staff of Ellis Inspection Services.  If I need a home inspection in the Gulf Shores area, I'll call Jim first.

text: Wes did a wonderful job inspecting our home, not only that, but took all the time on the phone I needed to address each and every issue down to small details and answered all my questions, gave me a lot of confidence moving forward with my purchase. His drone shots of the roof added to my confidence and shows he uses the latest technology available to write his reports.

name: Walt
text: My wife and I are first time home buyers. I've only been able to read and research the process of buying a house. We do not have a "buyer's agent" but instead are using a transaction broker(unbeknownst to us until after closing had begun). That being said, everything that I have researched recommended being there for the home inspection to see for your own eyes the problems and repairs that need to be made before making a decision on buying a house. Unfortunately only my wife could make part of the inspection as I could not due to work demands after the hurricane. Mr. Wesley made me feel like I was there and explained the concerns to me as if they were his own. Our transaction broker suggested that we not be "nit picky" so the deal would go through. With Mr. Wesley's help, we were able to find the issues that we would not, and could not budge on. I strongly recommend him to anyone based on our experience. He even took time out of his Saturday during the half time show to go over the report in more detail with me. In a world rife with carelessness, his personalized and detailed attitude was refreshing and really made us feel important. The most thanks from myself, my wife, and our children, to you and your team Mr. Wesley! If we ever go into closing on another home,  Delta Home Inspections will be the name on the inspection report!

name: Kareem Bedeir
text: Thorough, knowledgable, takes the time to educate and punctual. Excellent.

name: Lisa Mitchell
text: Wesley conducted a home inspection this morning on a home my husband and I are purchasing.  I was impressed when I spoke with him initially on the phone.  He was very personable and seemed to have a genuine concern about the job he would be doing.  He mentioned that he preferred have us there to interact with and discuss issues on site.  When we arrived this morning right from the start I felt like my concerns were taken seriously and addressed very professionally.  He even took time to look into things that were not part of the home inspection.  I had wondered about whether a particular wall had wallpaper or paint on it and as the very kind person Wesley is he took the time away from what he was doing to take covers off outlets and determined the walls were in fact painted and then discussed with me the best way to cover the existing paint job.  This was above and beyond what he came there to do.  This is just one example, there were a couple more times during the inspection where he stopped and offered his expert opinion on things.  The inspection he did was very thorough.  I could not be more pleased.  He was extremely honest with his findings and I 100% trust his judgement and advice.  I highly recommend his services to anyone needed a home inspected.  You will NOT be disappointed.  In fact I plan to keep him in my contacts.  He does repairs as well, but Alabama state law will not allow him to work for a previous customer within 1 year, but any repairs I need after 1 year I will be calling Wesley to do!

text: I really can’t thank Wesley enough for all that he’s done to help put me at ease with the home buying experience. As another reviewer had stated, try to be present during his inspections because you will learn so much from him- all knowledge and expertise from his wealth of field experience. As expensive as it is to purchase a home, and as many problems can develop, especially with older structures, a through inspection by a qualified inspector is a must. Delta Home Inspections is the company to do the job! Mike Thomason

name: Roger N
text: We contacted Mr. Bounds after  noticing some slight ‘bulging’ and paint peeling from the crown molding in our dining room in our new home. Steve did a thorough inspection of the area to include a 'dampness' test and determined the issue was due to a pinhole puncture in the hot water pipe that had occurred during construction/finishing of the interior 2 years earlier. Although the "New Home" warranty was no longer valid, Steve walked us through the process of contacting the builder and made himself available when the builder's representative arrived to conduct their inspection to determine culpability. Steve's steadfast determination and support was instrumental in getting the builder to repair the damaged pipe, redo the drywall & paint over the affected area at No cost to us. I highly recommend Steve for anyone purchasing a new or used home.

Steve

name: Susan Wilson-Maher
text:
We depended on this inspector to be our eyes when buying our home, we did have some safety issues noted and had the sellers fix them but there was no mention of any issues with the floors or foundation. The floors in the home are so uneven that you can physically see where they slope and certainly can feel it when you walk on them. It will take 9k to resolve the issue to include jackhammering the new floor we installed in the basement for an apartment. The corner of the foundation was visibly cracked on the rear corner of the home which will need to be jacked up from underneath. 50 percent of the windows either fall out when trying to open them or don't stay open because the tracks are broken. Inspector said he opened several windows, must have been lucky to get the ones that did open correctly.
We were unable to be at the home with the inspector because we lived out of state and depended solely on his expertise, we were certainly let down. We would have never purchased the home or at least had the sellers address the issues.

He does a great job explaining/highlighting specific issues if you are able to be on site during his inspection. As long as we are buying property in the Birmingham area Jerry will be our go to inspector.

text:
Jerry Kelly recently did the inspection of a house we are buying. He is meticulous in his approach to his work and, in my opinion, went beyond was is typically expected in an inspection.  He also advised us about some of the items of concern that he found....some that need immediate attention and others that are things to watch in the long term.
I highly recommend Jerry to anyone who is purchasing a house and needs a thorough inspection service.

He sent a very thorough report that same night. He was available and easy to communicate with throughout the entire process. My brother recommended him to me and I am so glad!
