name: TheOneAndSecond
text: I was incredibly worried About finding a good inspector and did not have time to really research and Jerry with Southern Home was available. Being unsure I was at the home during the full inspection. Jerry was very professional and prompt. He spent 5 hours thoroughly looking in every corner of the home. He literally found everything we needed to know about the home. Incredibly detailed and thorough. His inspection report delivery is the most professional and secure as well as allows you to include your relator and mortgage broker. I really lucked up finding Jerry as my inspector!  This has allowed us to find what we needed to know to either move forward with the purchase or not!  I knew there were issues with this home and did not tell him to see if he would find them. He did and was very detailed. I will use him again and happily refer friends and family!   I highly encourage you you consider him for your inspection needs!

text: Daniel was very easy to work with. He always answered the phone, and explained the process before the inspection day so that I would know what to expect. He was also very helpful and responsive after the inspection when I would call with questions or concerns. I feel like most people would send you the report and check you off the list, however Daniel did the exact opposite. Lastly, his price was very reasonable. Overall, Daniel is very professional, easy going, and makes the process run smoothly.

text: Daniel did an excellent job! He did a very thorough inspection and I highly recommend him to anyone needing a home inspection.

name: Todd Jones
text: Daniel Hollis is exactly what I look for in an inspector. He's professional, personable, knowledgeable, thorough, honest, unbiased, and did I mention THOROUGH! He scours the property inside and out uncovering every possible fault. He then walks you through his findings and explains in detail everything that is wrong AND right with the property. He uses pictures to SHOW you where/why/how and welcomes any questions or concerns. His PDF report (which was received only a few hours after the inspection) is like an illustrated home buying guide that the buyer can use during negotiations and after the sale. Prior to meeting with Mr. Hollis and viewing his report, we were dead set on buying this home. But thankfully he uncovered some water issues in the basement which were a red flag for us. We backed out of the contract and feel very fortunate to have not purchased the property. Hollis Home Inspections potentially saved us from years of nightmares in what we thought was our dream home.

name: Ginger Fountain
text: Hollis Home Inspections is very easy to get in touch with before and after the home inspection progress.  Even when the buyer requests repairs to be made, Daniel is nice enough to speak to the seller or seller's contractor to make them fully aware of what actions need to be taken.

text: Mr. Regard is amazing. I spoke with him a week or so prior than needing services to get a quote on inspecting a home I am purchasing. I told him that I had just received my offer back and I was ready, he took down needed information for the home and my agent's info and told me he would be in touch. The next morning before 8AM I had a very detailed inspection report in my email from Mr. Regard. I would definitely recommend Mr. Robert Regard at Advanced Home Inspection Services to all my friends and family for all their inspection needs. ****CHOOSE ADVANCED HOME INSPECTION SERVICES***...YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT.

name: Rae Bolton
text:
Gave glowing inspection on a house that needed foundation work and reassured me issues were of no concern to avoid fixing under guarantee.

I used A-Pro for a pre-purchase inspection last year. As a first time home buyer I relied on Brent the inspectors opinion of the home being in good shape and with no major concerns. As soon as we moved in we noticed issues not on the report that looked like foundation problems which we contacted Brent about and were assured these were nothing to worry about.  6 months after moving in, we had to have significant foundation repair work done. I selected A-pro because they included a foundation report and a guarantee. I would not recommend A Pro or Brent to anyone.

name: Meredith Taylor
text:
Darrell Clark inspected our home back in May. My only concern with the home was the wiring since it was built in 1967. I specifically asked him to check the branch wiring to insure that it was copper, which he did and he assured me that all branch wiring was copper and recently updated. Fast forward 2 1/2 months and we have an electrician out for some faulty plugs who informs us that our ENTIRE house is wired with ALUMINUM.

This was caught within their "iron-clad 120 day assurance guarantee" so we contacted Darrell immediately. He and my husband had a good, long phone conversation and he admitted that he goofed this one up and had already contacted his insurance adjuster to come out to our house for an estimate as he was going to cover the rewiring of our home.

Three weeks go by and we hadn't heard from any insurance adjuster or updates from Darrell so we contact Darrell again to follow up. His response was that the insurance adjusters and underwriters were probably very busy because of the hurricanes. (this was after Harvey and Irma)

Three months go by without a word from Darrell after several attempts to reach him. We were advised by our realtor to contact the corporate office after her failed attempts to reach him as well. We were contacted pretty quickly by someone in corporate to hear us out. After she got into contact with Darrell he said he did not recollect a conversation with me about wiring at the initial inspection and he did not recollect a conversation with my husband about rectifying his mistake.

Darrell Clark is a liar and a sub par home inspector. We probably would have walked away from the purchase of our home had he not mistaken ALUMINUM wiring for copper. We certainly would not have paid what we did for the house.

name: Claire Cressman
text: Cory was the inspector on a property we are looking to purchase. He was so thorough in every way possible. He explained every aspect of of the home, everything he found, good, bad or indifferent. I liked that as the wife, he talked to me not just my husband. I don't have a lot of experience with home inspections, but I will say that I came out of it feeling like I knew the property inside and out, was informed, and had a go to person for referrals and resources beyond just the information he provided.  Very pleased!

name: Fred K
text: In June, my wife and I closed on a home purchase in Hoover, AL. The home was inspected in May by Jones-Warren Home Inspection Services. I just recently entered the attic to address some minor HVAC issues and immediately observed large amounts of unusual debris on the white insulation. This debris turned out to be nut shells, seed husks, and animal droppings. Further examination revealed a rat trap, an adhesive trap, extensive amounts of animal droppings. I then found the carcass of squirrel. When I reached out the CEO, Meredith Warren, she replied dismissing any responsibility and giving reasons why. I replied stating to her I could show her how glaringly obvious the infestation was and prove the infestation existed when the home was inspected. I invited her to come and take a look for herself. She never replied. I did a lot of research in this matter because I know a home inspection can’t reveal everything. But one thing that became clear to me is that a trained inspector should be particularly on the lookout for safety and health related issues so a potential buyer can make an informed decision. How he missed the signs of a squirrel infestation four feet away from his vantage point is beyond me.

resp.text: Hi Fred, we understand that you believe that a squirrel infestation was existing at the time of the inspection even though it was wasn’t discovered until 2.5 months after the inspection had been performed. We take any claims of missed items extremely seriously and  did not dismiss your claims out of hand. After we reviewed your inspection report,  we sent you the photos of the attic from the report with about 6-8 different comprehensive overviews of the attic from the inspection that look nothing like what you sent us in your email. You emailed back stating that you wouldn’t send us the obvious proof you have. Why would you refuse to send it? This is a reasonable and logical request most people and businesses being accused of missing something would make. At this time, we do not feel it would be prudent to come to your home when you’re  already extremely confrontational and angry when you could simply send us the proof you say you have to clear this to up right now.

I’m going forward with my appointment because as someone getting ready to move I can’t take on extra fees. But I found it very unprofessional how it was handled and that there was no exception for the unforeseen events that are taking place. But I will not allow him in my home without mask and gloves.

name: Daniel Coady
text:
within a month of the inspection two different leaks were found in plumbing. One of them enormous rotted out section of the drain pipe that could not possibly have happened since the inspection. Of course they deny any wrongdoing. As they do in response to every other bad review i've seen, so that doesn't surprise me. Allen Warren Jones is about as rude as it gets. Will beg real estate agents and home owners to not use this company.

In Response to Warren Jones comment below: I wouldn't have even left a bad review if you would have just done the right thing and refunded the 400$ for this inspection. Instead of saying you would refund it and then changing your mind. I think I am owed at least that much for your negligence. I might have even just accepted an apology for how allen acted on the phone and moved on. But no apology of course. I've done 1000$ worth of inspections with ya'll and you're too petty to admit you may have made a mistake and refund the money. I'm not worried about the four pages,  I'm worried about these Major, Expensive, and obvious leaks that you did not catch because you could not possibly have turned on the water upstairs before going down into the crawl space to look at the pipes. a 3 foot section of a pipe was leaking. Just swallow your pride, admit you may have made a mistake.

resp.text: Hi Daniel, we're sorry that you're upset that we aren't willing to pay for or file a general liability claim, as you suggested, to correct deficiencies that are in the home inspection report. There were many plumbing issues and electrical issues that are in the report. Unfortunately, there is no way for us to estimate when more problems may occur. I'll post some photos of the Report Summary so you can refamiliarize yourself with the 4 pages of issues found during the inspection. Please let us know if you have any questions regarding the information on the Summary Report.

resp.text: HI Gabe, we're sorry that you felt like you didn't get what you were looking for from the home inspection but it is our policy for safety and quality assurance to not allow someone to shadow the inspector. We are always happy to discuss the findings of the report and show you the problem areas and answer any questions at the end of the inspection or before the client leaves. As far as "selling" your information, that is completely a baseless claim. There is no money exchanged to offer our clients a promotion from ADT and you chose not to opt out of it. We wish you the best of luck.

name: Ravi Kumar
text: In efficient inspection, missed several things. I had to fix them when missed things were identified after closing. Of course, the inspection service was done last year. A grossly missed crack from eave to ground  in the exterior brick wall raises concerns beyond cosmetics.

resp.text: Hi Ravi, we completed your inspection in July 2017 (11 months ago) and you contacted us with your concerns in November 2017 which was 4 months after the inspection. Because our company wide standard is to produce excellent home inspections, we met with you in November at the home and went over your concerns in detail before you even purchased the home. As we explained in November, the items you brought to our attention were cosmetic items (like needing to re-caulk a few places in the crown moulding) and are not part of a home inspection and are specifically excluded as part of the ASHI standards of practice that all Alabama licensed home inspectors abide by which were also stated in our home inspection contract that you signed. If there have been subsequent items that you believe were missed in the July 2017 inspection, please contact us at our office to set up a time to discuss them.

name: greg elmore
text:
Inspector seemed like he was in a hurry throughout the entire process . Didnt seem to want to discuss anything with us at all when we ask questions. Lastly. Missed a leaky hot water heater (which had to be replaced), missed a bad condensate pump on furnace, missed a huge foundational issue that will cost 1000s to repair. I showed him the cracks since he didnt pick them up on his own and he said nothing to worry about. Well he was wrong as I found out a month after we moved in. The worst part is once they found out thru my realtor I was not happy. They had some you guy call me who wanted to argue about what they are really supposed to do and not do. He actually told me they did not represent the buyers that they were neutral. When I told him I paid the fee and they worked for me the buyer and I was done arguing. The little man hung up on me. Do yourself a favor. Pick an inspector who is looking out for the buyer not one who is just trying to make sure the deal goes thru.  These guys simply check off boxes on their list, nothing more.

To respond to below:
So my last name is changed on all Google platforms for several reasons. If you would like to give me a name of someone to call that doesnt hang up on clients, I am more than happy to call and speak with them. However the damage is done. I will be out over $10000 paying for the items you missed or dismissed as nothing to worry about. The simple fact your employee hung up on me and was so disrespectful tells a lot about the culture at Jones Warren. That and the way in which the inspector dismissed my concerns and was not willing to take time to discuss. How a business handles a problem says a lot about them. The damage is done and good buyers should know that while you guys are a big supplier for the market, if there is a problem it will not be resolved easily and you do not treat clients with the respect they deserve. My realtor has already told me she will no longer reccomend you guys based on what we have had to deal with as a result of your poor service and the bad attitude of your employee.

resp.text: Hi Greg, I'm sorry to hear that you didn't feel like you got good service when you had a home inspection. I've tried looking you up in our Birmingham system and I can't find where you were a client. If you can provide that information, I'd be happy to look into your situation.

name: Sarah
text:
I am choosing to post this here after the company deactivated their star ratings/reviews on their Facebook page after I posted the review below.  A genuine apology would have been the professional thing to do and I would have been happy to update my review at that point.

I had forgotten to post this until they sent me an email this weekend. I got a home inspection with them in July 2016 and ran into quite a few problems.
-After reviewing the inspection received on July 13, I noticed that no true roof inspection was actually done. The report stated that all the inspector did was look at the roof from the ground with binoculars. This is in contradiction to what Jones-Warren assures will be completed in one of their inspections. They even say on this Facebook page that they "get on every roof no matter how steep". I made Allen aware of this via email.
-Due to concern over the inspection, my Uncle drove 9 hours up from Florida for us to do a second inspection. We found multiple items that the inspector didn't find (half the windows in the home not working properly, attic fan not functioning) and even that some of the items he found were more severe than he had stated (back door didn't need repair-had to be replaced).
-A few days after this, the seller's agent contacted mine to accuse me of sending my Uncle back to their home without a proper request (he had been back in FL for days). Someone had gone to their home and knocked on their door asking to get on their roof. I later found out this was Allen Warren when he called me to discuss my dissatisfaction. He stated his intention was to test to see if the inspector's ladder had been tall enough for him to get on the roof. While I appreciated the research, it was very unprofessional for him to go there unannounced and caused a ton of animosity between all parties involved.
-As stated above, Allen did call me to discuss the issues and originally seemed very genuine that they fully intended to rectify the situation. He said that the other owner would be giving me a call later that day to get more details and work out a resolution. I never received any further contact from either of them, even after I emailed Allen a few weeks later (Aug 11) to say I was still waiting on a call.
-I am very disappointed that I never reviewed a resolution to this after paying the full amount for a thorough home inspection. I'm not sure if they intentionally never got back to me or it simply fell through the cracks, but I definitely would not recommend based on my experience.

name: Amanda Helton
text: Fantastic customer service!  Personable, prompt & accurate.  Great company & people!!!!

name: Andy Gagliano
text:
I have referred many clients to Jones-Warren Home Inspection Services, and they have never disappointed my clients or me.
Most home inspectors seem to come in 2 types. The first is the "The Sky Is Falling" type that leads potential homebuyers to believe that a light bulb that is blown in a fixture is a major electrical problem that could cause the home to burn completely to the ground.  The second type is the "Blind Inspector" type who doesn't find anything wrong with any home ever.
Jones-Warren Home Inspections has created a 3rd type of inspection service which is a perfect blend of the middle of the road between "The Sky Is Falling" home inspectors and the "Blind Inspectors".  Jones-Warren's inspectors do a great job of noting what is wrong with a home and explaining to the buyer what, if any, implications that deficiency in that home may have on their safety, well-being, and enjoyment of that property.
In addition to their excellent initial homebuying inspection services, they also will re-inspect the home after the seller has repaired any items that the buyer has requested for the seller of that property to repair.  This can result in the savings of a couple of hundred dollars for the homebuyer. And, in today's costly homebuying environment, every dollar saved is important.
I highly recommend Jones-Warren to anyone searching for a reputable home inspection service for their home purchase.

resp.text: Thank you so much Andy and we really appreciate your referrals!

name: Justin Hardy
text: Reliable, courteous, and professional. I would recommend them to anyone

resp.text: Thank you Justin for your confidence in our services!

name: Mallory Halpin
text:
Let me first say the inspector did a wonderful job. My complaint is with the scheduling staff and the managers/owners.

I was under the impression I scheduled an inspection for a friday morning. Friday morning rolls around and no inspector. I even had a hardwood specialist with me to inspect at the same time. (We werent allowed in home without inspector per AL law?)  So not only did I not have the inspection done on time, I had to reschedule the hardwood specialist.  When i called friday morning asking where the inspector was, the office staff had no evidence of my request for an appointment. Even though my realtor and the selling realtor both got a confirmation.

One lady in the office was very helpful and set me up with another appointment. However,  although my inspector was great, it was not who I requested.

After having some additional difficulty getting my realtor access to the report, I called the office to file the complaint. I was told by a secrety that the owner told her to tell me that they couldnt do any type of refund because the system wouldn't allow it. The owner never returned my phone calls (yes, more than one call) nor answer emails.

Again, the inspector was great, but if you want reliable appointment timing and ease of reports etc, don't use this company. A simple call back from the owner/manager with a genuine apology would've been appreciated.

resp.text:
Hi Mallory, I'm sorry that you felt frustrated with your experience.  When you called us the first time stating that we had missed your appointment, my office staff did notify me and I checked our phone logs (which are from Google Voice and I am the only person who is able to access them) and I also checked our scheduling software as a way to figure out if we had indeed somehow missed your appointment.

Our Google Voice phone records show no calls from your phone number until the day you called us about missing the appointment and there was no information about you in our scheduling system (all appointments that are started, even if they aren't fully scheduled, are saved automatically and can not be permanently erased by anyone other than me).  I do this so that I can monitor what is being done.

I'm sure that you did schedule an appointment with a home inspection company, I just don't believe it was ours.  We do appreciate that you chose to work with us, however, we don't believe this situation called for discounting our services though you requested one several times after you scheduled your appointment.

We wish you the best of luck with your new home.

name: Good Citizen (Good Citizen)
text:
Inspection report was good, process was fast and price was fair.
However, they sell your phone number and you get calls day and night from security companies claiming to be partners with alliance.

resp.text: Thank you for the positive comment about our inspection, feedback is valuable to us. We apologize about the calls you are receiving and assure you we do not sell your information.  However, we do offer a free concierge service with vendors we represent that you may have opted in on. Please feel free to call us at 251-382-1653 so that we can assist removing you from this service.

name: Linda Nesselroad
text:
Thank you so  much John Greer.
If we find another home that we are interested in buying you would be the only one that we would have do the inspection.  You saved us from making a lifetime mistake.  Thank you again for opening our eyes to things we need to pay attention to when looking for a home.

resp.text:
You're very welcome, Linda. It's wonderful that the process was educational and helped you to make a solid decision! It was great to work with you, and we're here to help if you need us again.
John Greer, Pillar To Post Home Inspectors

name: Michael Battey
text: John was very thorough and had a keen eye for all material deficits of the house I wanted to buy.  I avoided buying a real pig of a house and a money pit.  The sellers were greedy, clueless heirs who were unwilling to fix anything, so I cancelled my contract with them.  Beware of Alabama realtors, they are mostly sleezy crooks.

resp.text:
Michael, thank you! We're so glad that we could help find the potential issues in the home so that you could make a confident decision not to move through with the purchase. If we can do anything else for you, please let us know.
John Greer, Pillar To Post Home Inspectors

name: Dorothy LaFever
text:
Brief, almost a non existent explanation of anything included in his report.  Areas such as roof, gives no findings on how the roof is, the deterioration factor, how long it might have left...details, details. There simply aren't any details to the home inspection report. Basically no mention of kitchen other than 'serviceable'  yet when I see cabinets, they are loose or broken off hinges, heavy scratches.

The report is a poor comparison to what the actual houses state is in.

Don't put trust into this man's inspections, there simply too limp.

name: Michael Swift
text: John has been our home inspector on 3 different homes and his complete inspection report was the choosing factor in our home purchase. Thank you so much for your service!!

resp.text:
You're welcome, Michael! Thanks for letting us know that you're pleased with our services. It was a pleasure to work with you and wonderful that the information helped you make a solid decision.
John Greer, Pillar To Post Home Inspectors

name: Bobbie Barber
text: As soon as I called, my call was returned. Fast service, detailed report returned to me. This made the purchase of our new home a more comfortable experience!

name: Tricia Mayes
text: Very detailed, covered everything. Above and beyond expectations.. I would highly recommend your services.

resp.text:
Hello Tricia, thank you so much for your kind review! It's great to know you were pleased with the inspection and that our work has earned your recommendation. We appreciate that you chose Pillar To Post for your home inspection services!
John Greer, Pillar To Post Home Inspectors

name: Brittney Abarca
text: Great work, very friendly, a fair price, easy to reach, & gets things done very fast.

resp.text:
Hello Brittney, this is what we like to hear! Thanks for sharing your review. We're glad we had the chance to help with your inspection.
John Greer, Pillar To Post Home Inspectors

name: KMW Farm
text:
On Fri Feb 02, 2018 at 11:09 PM Kenny/Mary Wallace

How thorough John was and how well he explained everything to us.

resp.text:
Our team enjoyed working with you both, Kenny and Mary. Thank you for the words of praise, it was my pleasure to provide you with a thorough inspection. We look forward to working with you both in the future. Best regards.
John, Pillar To Post Home Inspectors

name: Lauren Revelle
text: Quick and helpful with any questions.

resp.text:
Thanks for taking the time to leave us a post, Lauren, and for your praise. We want to get our customers into their new homes as quickly and painlessly as possible, and to put their minds at ease by answering any and all questions as best we can. We sure do appreciate your business and we hope everything is going well!
John Greer, Pillar To Post Home Inspectors

name: Brock Murphy
text: Friendly, prompt and a fair price

resp.text:
Hi Brock, thank you! We're beyond pleased to see this terrific rating.
John Greer, Pillar To Post Home Inspectors

name: Mark Brewer
text: Great work and communication.

resp.text:
Thank you, Mark! It's great to know that you were pleased with our services.
John Greer, Pillar To Post Home Inspectors

name: Jeffrey Reynolds
text: Great company, very friendly, very thorough

resp.text:
Thank you for taking the time to post this 5-star review, Jeffrey. It means a lot.
John Greer, Pillar To Post Home Inspectors

name: Nicole Morris
text: I'm on here to add one more glowing review to the list - Greg and Tandi Smith are running a superb business. They are quick to respond, courteous, and knowledgeable. The online booking option is convenient and easy-to-use. Greg allowed me to accompany him during his work, and I gained wonderful insight about the home I'm planning to purchase. The inspection report is thorough, and easy to navigate, with pictures notating each of the systems included. I am very happy to recommend them!

name: Ashley Brisco
text: These guys were great. They were super responsive, and worked with me on flexibility of schedule in a big way. Furthermore, the inspection itself was thorough and the final output was very readable & digestible. He took it very seriously and and took his time and care in explaining all the things he recommended. I am very please with the process overall.

name: Shelby Polio
text: Greg was excellent! He was recommended to us by some friends for our home inspection and I see why! We was extremely thorough, knowledgeable, able to answer all questions, and help guide us through what’s next in this tricky process. We will definitely be calling him again in the future!!!

name: Matt Carrier
text:
Greg preformed a home inspection for us as perspective buyer. He was extremely thorough, professional, courteous and knowledgeable.  We highly recommend Greg and Housemasters Home Inspection!

We have contracted Greg and Tandi at Housemasters for our third inspection as our home search continues. As a result of Greg's excellent eye and professional knowledge, we have been able to avoid some money pits! Greg and Tandi are our GO TO home inspectors and we would not buy a house without their services...

name: Paul Sholly
text: Greg does a great job of pointing out problem areas during the inspection and helping you understand what kind of repairs the house might need. The turnaround time for the report is fast, and it’s EXTREMELY detailed, with pictures at ever bullet point. He does such a good job that I actually backed out of a purchase contract because of his report.

name: D O
text: Greg did a great job reviewing the issues on a house I am purchasing. The turn around time on the report was next day and detailed. I would recommend HouseMaster to anyone that needs a thorough inspection.

name: Adam Hickman
text: David inspected a home we are wanting to buy and went over and above on the job. He was very thorough on the inspection and pointed out everything he could tell me about the home. David went through the entire house and used his drone to inspect the siding and roof. Afterwards, he walked my wife and I through the home and pointed out what he found and later that night delivered the report with pictures by email. Great business and good work. This is actually the 2nd time we have used Housemaster in Birmingham and would definitely used them a 3rd time.

name: Amanda Watts
text: Greg has performed 2 home inspections for me now. He is extremely thorough in his work, and very open and helpful in discussing issues or repairs. I feel very confident I know what to look for and expect in my new home.

name: Kat Kendyll
text: Greg inspected a home we were interested in buying. We very much appreciated his thoroughness. Also he was great about fully explaining what he found and what concerns there were, if any. He made our decision much easier. Thanks!

name: Stephenie Higgins
text: Greg and Tandi were knowledgeable and professional. They were responsive and helpful with the process of getting a home inspection. I highly recommend them. Also very reasonable prices.

name: Jim Dunn
text: Outstanding !!! I received a recommendation from another HouseMasters customer. Tandi and Greg were professional and thorough. I met Greg late in the inspection and he took the time to go over the details with me. He submitted a report the next day. I would recommend HouseMasters Home Inspections.

name: B Zoo
text: OUTSTANDING! -- I found Greg Smith at HouseMaster Birmingham to be the most personable, thorough and knowledgeable inspector that I've ever worked with to date!!! He arrived early and Greg was excellent in his communications on findings, areas to maintain and suggestions for repairs. He was very patient and thorough answering all of my questions and took the time to show me specific things. Greg was generous with his time in explaining the issues he found. I am very impressed with the level of service and quality of care he put into my inspection. Greg was also able to get the full report into my hands within 12 hours of the inspection, which seems extraordinarily fast from my past experiences. And his report was extremely comprehensive.  I cannot say enough good things about Greg and give him my HIGHEST recommendation. I will use HouseMasters Home Inspections again!

name: daniel holifield
text: Probably the most thorough inspection out there. Do not hesitate to book him for your home inspection. He was patient with me, explained everything he was doing and gave me a great perspective on the house.

name: Linc Cassady
text: We were very impressed with Greg and his level of service.  He was very thorough in his inspection, and was patient with us as we asked questions.  He addressed all of our concerns, and pointed out areas of concern that we would have missed without him.  I highly recommend.

name: Agus Wardana
text: Best and so detail. Recommended

name: Jason Junkins
text: Greg is extremely detailed and thorough.  You will not go wrong with his service and you get tons of value for the price.  Highly recommend.

name: Darren Holbrooks
text: Very thorough. Thought we had the perfect home. Inspector raised a concern about a retaining wall that looked fine to us. Called in two experts to check out wall and discovered we were looking at huge expense of $24,000 or more to stabilize it. Dodged a major bullet to our finances.

name: James Dia
text: Greg did a great job. Thoroughly went through the inspection with me and was very professional.

name: Gwen Lockett
text: Greg from HouseMaster did a home inspection for me a few weeks ago and I must say he was great. Greg was on time, very detailed and explained a lot of things to me that was very helpful in making a decision about buying the house. I will definitely recommend HouseMaster to family and friends.

name: Devin Decker
text: I am a licensed AL Realtor and one of my Buyer Clients recently hired HouseMaster Home Inspections for their potential purchase.  Greg and his team were punctual, excellent at communication and follow up, delivered the report fast and as promised, and answered questions and concerns during the inspection. Will definitely be recommending HouseMaster Home Inspections to my future clients.

name: Taylor Hart
text: Greg and his team were so great to work with!  Exactly what you want out of an inspector.  Extremely knowledgeable and easy to talk to.  We are better off with our house having used his services.  And the ease of use with the websites was a huge plus.

name: Jeff Fowler
text: Had a short timeframe to get our inspection done and they were very accommodating.  Thorough and detailed report.  Will help a great deal with negotiating our purchase and peace of mind afterward.

name: Beth McCoun
text: Greg is a great inspector. He takes the time to do a great job, communicates well, and is very trustworthy! They answer questions quickly. Highly Recommended!

name: Pam Files
text: Greg has always been one of the best inspectors to choose!   I guess if a realtor uses him for their personal property....it goes without saying, he is the one to trust!  Thanks Greg for taking care of me personally this time~!

name: Yolanda J Wyatt
text:
I highly recommend this company. The inspection went smoothly, The inspector walked me through and explained all points of interest to me in  terms that were easy to understand. The report was detailed and covered important things I would never thought to ask the seller. I'm very happy I chose House Masters.
Yolanda W.

name: Hunter Billinsgley
text: Thankful for the service provided by House Masters. Our inspector was very thorough and honest. You could tell his interest were pointed at providing us a report that would help us better understand the quality of house were we looking to buy. Thank you!

name: Bruce Jacobson
text: Great job.  Did a very thorough job.  Well pleased. We plan on purchasing one more house before we go into full retirement.  We will use HouseMaser for the inspection .

name: kimberlyclay
text: Greg did two home inspections for me. He is so thorough, and explains the process in detail.  I chose not to go through with the first one because he found issues I was unaware of. Thank  you for your wonderful expertise!

name: Roxanne R
text: I love working with Housemasters.  Their reports are very thorough and include lots of pictures for reference.  They are always on time and very reliable.  Price for the report is more than fair.  Tandi and Greg are great people to work with!

name: kimberlyclay
text: Greg did two home inspections for me. He is so thorough, and explains the process in detail.  I chose not to go through with the first one because he found issues I was unaware of. Thank  you for your wonderful expertise!

name: Ray Powell
text: I have been a Realtor for 17 years and Greg Smith with HouseMaster is definitely one of the most knowledgeable and thorough Home Inspectors that you will find.  His wife, Tandi, is the Office Manager and is a pleasure in which to work!  I would highly recommend Greg and Tandi !

name: Mike Ash
text: Greg did an incredible job. He was very thorough, and he helped us catch some things that we were able to get the seller pay for, saving us money post-buying our home.

name: Jon Wilson
text: Greg provided an awesome Inspection for us.    Very thorough, he arrived on time, professional, and we received the Report back right away .    Nice work !

name: Bill McMichael
text: HouseMaster home inspection is a good choice for your home inspection. The Folks that bought my mom's home used them in 2016. I was so impressed with their thoroughness that I used them on a recent inspection needed on a home that I am looking at buying. And again extremely pleased with their attention to small detail. I definitely Recommend HouseMasters.

name: Jeffrey Bagley
text: Greg was very thorough and informative. I really appreciated his hard work and attention to detail.

name: David Oldham
text: Greg is very thorough and a pleasure to deal with. Highly recommended.

name: Krystle Ong
text: Greg and Tandi were great to work with! Greg was very thorough with the inspection and explained every item that needed attention in detail. As a first time homebuyer, this was super important to me so I would understand exactly what needed to be fixed before closing, and what I would be responsible for after. Highly recommend.

name: Allan Gambrell
text: I've used them twice now and I've found them to be very thorough, prompt, and considerate. Would definitely recommend.

name: Judy Ping
text: On Time, courteous, diligent. Explained all aspects to my clients. Professional company.

name: Dylan Ward
text: Excellent service and extremely nice people to work with. Will definitely use again for any future inspections!

name: Susie Westbrook
text: HouseMaster always does  a terrific job for my clients. They are thorough, informative, professional and courteous.  I highly recommend them.

name: Galen Jones
text: Awesome and thorough job. We could not be happier to hsve had the service of Greg and Tandi  from HouseMaster conduct our inspection. I recommend them with the highest regards;-)

name: Allyson Bailes
text: This is the second home inspection we have had done within the last 6 months and we have chosen Greg both times and he hasn’t let us down once!! Greg was very friendly, honest, and thorough throughout our entire inspection! The report was very detailed and Greg went over every single thing before we left. I highly recommend Greg Smith for any home inspection you might need!

name: K D
text:
I was selling my home when the buyer hired Greg Smith with Housemaster.  I've closed on the home - with that buyer - so this isn't sour grapes, but when someone come in to inspect a home, I expect them to leave it in the order they found it.  Instead, the coffee pot reservoir was turned off, the fireplace screen was left half-open (instead of fully closed), he had turned on the guest shower without pulling the shower liner and left a puddle of water on the wood floors, the touch faucet in kitchen was turned off, the man door in garage was left unlocked.
Additionally, he was extremely nit-picky as he couldn't find anything major wrong with the house.
The job of an inspector is to certainly look out for any unknowns for the buyer; however, it is not to be an alarmist when unwarranted. And any home inspector should leave the home exactly as it was when he entered.

name: Mike Smith
text: A very detailed inspection. Greg explained the report and offered his contact information if questions arose.

name: Chase McCain
text: Greg and Tandi always do a great job. Greg is a very thorough and fair inspector. His reports are easy to read and understand. You are in great hands with Housemaster.

name: Sarah Wilson
text: I honestly can't imagine having a better home inspection experience. Greg was thorough, patient and professional. As a first time home buyer, I was uncertain what to expect from the process. After we left, all of my questions were answered, and I was given a complete and efficient run-down and summary of the inspection findings. Best of all, I received the final summary and documentation in less than 24 hours. I am beyond thrilled with the quality of service, and would highly recommend HouseMaster Home Inspection.

name: Ronald Sereika
text:
I used Housemasters for my first inspection on4/30/19 and was extremely satisfied with the way they performed the inspection. They looked at every window, every door, turned the water on in all 5 bathrooms, flushed all the toilets. Tested every outlet, looked at the date on each furnace, heat pump, water heater, microwave. Reviewed the support beams for the deck, erosion of the driveway. Filled up the jacuzzi and let it run and drain. Let the showers run and watch them drain. Noticed the garbage disposal was on it lasts leg, listed the lights that needed new light bulbs, tested both garbage doors noting was not working properly.
The inspection was 3 1/2 hours and everything was documented on his laptop. Greg Smith’s work was World Class and his work allowed me and my wife to make a decision on a $400,000 home that would not have made if he had not been as diligent as he was. I will be using them again and you should also.

name: David Spurling
text: Many of my clients have used Greg through the years, and he does an excellent job. Greg is knowledgeable, friendly and professional. His reports are thorough and easy to interpret. And Tandi is great to work with on scheduling. They're a strong team.

name: Valerie Dee
text: I was very satisfied with the inspection performed by Greg Smith with HomeMaster Home Inspections. Greg was very thorough in his work. I would gladly recommend him to friends, family and anyone looking for a great company for their home inspections.

text:
I was very pleased with the information that was shared with me during the inspection and the very detailed report sent to me after the inspection. I would recomend them to anyone that's looking to buy or sell a house.

Thanks,
Joe

text: Very thorough and timely inspection report. Loved the 90 day warranty as well.

text: Very thorough and professional. Great feedback & photos. Completed in timely manner & explained every issue in detail. Would use this company again!

name: Kayla Crook
text: Greg with house masters has done 3 inspections for me over the years, he is always very professional and thorough. Would highly recommend!!

name: Matt Patterson
text: Greg was great and thorough with the inspection.  I would recommend him to anyone for their home inspection.

name: Karen Carden
text: Greg Smith always does a complete professional job.  I would highly recommend him.

name: Don Jones
text: We are out of town buyers and could not be there for the inspection, so it was especially important that we receive a thorough and concise report.  HouseMasters gave us both and allowed us to make an informed decision on the home we were considering. Great experience!

name: Lauren Tennant
text: Greg was very thorough and honest! We appreciated his feedback and he took the time to explain several inspection items to us. As first-time buyers, Greg made us feel very confident in our home purchase!

name: Jordan Yarbrough
text: Incredibly thorough inspection, and I got my report back very quickly. Some of the best money I could have spent during the homebuying process.

name: Kellie Peavy
text: Great service!  Helpful and willing to answer all questions in a friendly and knowledgeable manner. Extremely timely getting our report to us from our inspection.

name: Jessica Covington
text: Glen and Tandi Smith were lovely to work with. The inspector was very knowledgeable and took the time to explain anything I was unsure about, being a first time home buyer. He gave estimates on what he thought it would cost to fix the broken things within the house. He went above and beyond the terms of service when he started suggesting alternative ways to live with the broken items when he learned I didn't have the money to fix things immediately. He was on time and had a friendly personality. Tandi was very considerate of my work schedule when I was initially setting up the appointment and worked with me when I ended up needing to change the days. Over all I would highly recommend Housemaster in general and Tandi and Glen in particular.

name: Deneise Fondren
text: Greg was very thorough with the inspection for my buyers!  I highly recommend HouseMaster Home Inspections!

name: Toni Chapman
text: Very thorough, answers any questions the client has, on time for inspections, and professional.

name: Eugene Donaldson
text: Very thorough job and very helpful explaining the repairs necessary

text: Very pleased with services. Thorough, knowledgeable, informative and friendly. I definitely recommend Housemaster for your inspection needs.

name: Julie Watson
text: They have a terrible grading system that leaves buyers thinking a home is in worse condition than it is. They stated things were wrong with the home that were incorrect. I would never use this home inspector or recommend them to anyone.
